title: Keep Our Library Public!
short: We believe that all of the Blasco Erie County Public Library belongs to the public!
description: Keep Our Library Public (KOLP) has filed a legal complaint in the Erie County Court of Common Pleas to prevent 3200 square feet of Blasco Erie County Public Library in Erie County, PA from being leased to a tax-exempt, private, religious university. Please help us fund our legal fight!  Donations given through FundLibraries.org are tax deductible.

title: Fight Censorship in the Lapeer District Library!
short: Join your community's grassroots effort to keep censorship out of the Lapeer District Library. Together we can protect intellectual freedom.
description:
Join "Team 1923" as we work to defend our library district against direct attacks from book challengers and those who would defund the library.



Your donation will help Fight 4 the First Lapeer fund:

leafleting and letter writing campaigns

rallies, tabling events and student engagement opportunities

advertising

legal advice

supplies to support our efforts



The Lapeer District Library system consists of seven branches. The Marguerite deAngeli Library, generally considered the main branch,  completed in 1923,  was funded through a Carnegie Foundation grant. Our library system is overseen by a seven member board, and funded primarily through a local millage.



Beginning in early 2023, a "Requests for Reconsideration of Materials" campaign was begun by a small group of vocal individuals  Challenged materials were books with LGBTQ+ themes and titles from the Fifty Shades adult fiction series.   Threats were made to defund the library by defeating future millages if the books weren't removed. All challenges were denied  by the library's Director and, on appeal, by the library's Board of Trustees.



Since that time, individuals who previously supported these challenges have succeeded in being appointed to the LDL Board of Trustees, and are now trying to use those seats to restrict access to the same materials.  They have also stated publicly that the community may not support the next millage request if the materials are not restricted.



Fight 4 the First Lapeer and "Team 1923" will defend our library and the right to freely access information for all members of our community.



We sincerely thank you for your support, and hope you'll join Team 1923!

title: Let Utah Read - Stop Censorship in Utah
short: We are a coalition dedicated to preserving Americans’ freedom to choose what we read. Please help support our anti-censorship work.
description:
Let Utah Read is a coalition of Utah community members, educators, parents, librarians, and educational and advocacy organizations — all dedicated to preserving Americans’ freedom to choose what we read. 

We believe that all Americans have the right to read and access diverse and inclusive literature, free from censorship or discrimination, and that libraries are the foundation for a vibrant and engaged US citizenry.

We work to stop censorship and protect libraries and librarians against attacks by providing information and action alerts to Utahns who support the freedom to read.  

Your donation will underwrite the important work of educating Utahns and elected decision-makers through events, social media, publishing, speaking, and coalition-building.

title: California School Library Recovery Act Project
short: Asking for 1.5% of Prop 98, this ballot initiative can provide funding for the school libraries California’s students need and deserve.
description:
The proposed Delaine Eastin School Library Recovery act will take 1.5% of Prop 98 funds and apply them to school libraries and districts in California.

Our goal is to raise $2M in campaign funding to develop sound polling on the proposed ballot initiative, assess voter attitude in order to draft the initiative and grow popular support. Funds will go towards research, legal costs, campaign infrastructure,  petitions and outreach, and voter outreach.
organization: California School Library Recovery Act Project

title: Right to Read North Dakota
short: We educate and empower North Dakotans to protect the right to read for this generation and those to come.
description:
Right to Read ND is a nonpartisan group of North Dakotans who have come together in response to the growing movement to limit access to books and materials in our libraries and schools.

We educate and empower North Dakotans to protect the right to read for this generation and those to come. We also work to defeat legislation that violates our constitutional rights and infringes on our First Amendment right to access information.

VALUES

We believe in the right to access information without discrimination.

We oppose censorship.

We believe that we must protect the constitutional rights of our students and citizens to freely access information and ideas.

We trust teachers and librarians to choose materials and provide free access to information and books.

We believe that parents, not the government, should supervise reading choices for their own children.

We support our public institutions and oppose any efforts to defund public libraries and public schools.

We believe North Dakota library collections should be inclusive and reflect the diverse citizens of our communities.

title: Help Support Read Freely Alabama
short: Our state-wide grassroots group needs your help to fight back against anti-library extremism and censorship
description: Your generous donations go to fund our advocacy and outreach events, legislative initiatives, supplies, and technology/software to allow us to continue the fight against extremism in Alabama.

title: Safe Shelves: Protecting LGBTQ+ Books in Small Town Libraries
short: Help us defend inclusive collections under threat in conservative communities by funding locked display cases and staff training.
description:
In dozens of small-town libraries across the Midwest, books by and about LGBTQ+ people are being removed from shelves, vandalized, or hidden due to local pressure. Safe Shelves is a rapid-response project to help library staff keep these books accessible and protected.

Your donation will fund clear locking display cases, signage affirming the right to read, and staff training materials on patron privacy and intellectual freedom. We’re starting with three libraries in Iowa and Nebraska—but your support can help expand this effort nationally.

Books should never be silenced. Stand with us.

title: Project Library Polling Initiative
short: Help us raise the funds needed to conduct comprehensive polling on our upcoming library funding ballot measure.
description: Libraries are at the heart of every community, but we need solid data to ensure voters understand the full impact of our proposed ballot initiative. Your contribution will underwrite a professional polling firm to survey voters across the county—identifying key messages, measuring support levels, and pinpointing potential concerns. With clear, actionable insights in hand, our campaign can tailor outreach to build the broadest coalition in favor of stable, long-term library funding.

title: Storytime on Wheels
short: Help us convert a vintage food truck into a pop-up picture-book library that can roll into parks and community events all summer long.
description:
Why a mobile storytime?  

Many families in East Portland live miles from a branch library. Storytime on Wheels brings books, puppets, and lively read-alouds right to them. Your donation funds:  
• Custom shelving and book bins  
• A wheelchair-accessible ramp  
• Fuel and driver stipend through Labor Day  

Every $25 outfits the truck with a brand-new hardcover. Let’s put 300 stories on the street!
